cyclone.name: CLAUDETTE
cyclone.current_location: about 475 miles south of Morgan City, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: moving north toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then forecast to turn northeast across the southeastern United States
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast near Morgan City–Grand Isle area (north-central Gulf Coast)

weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City, LA to the Alabama/Florida border, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from coastal Louisiana eastward to coastal Alabama
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible Friday night into Saturday with a 24 % chance of sustained 34-kt winds and a 3 % chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft possible in Lake Pontchartrain and Lake Maurepas; 2–3 ft along open coast from Intracoastal City, LA to the MS/AL border.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated totals up to 12 inches likely, producing flash and urban flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes possible beginning Friday afternoon.
